title: Convert to Exponential Form
text: First, convert the expression to exponential form. To convert a logarithmic equation to exponential form, we need to identify the base of the exponential, a, and the exponent $$y$$ since $$y=\log_{a}\left(x\right)$$ is equivalent to $$x=a^y$$.
speech: First, convert the expression to exponential form. To convert a logarithmic equation to exponential form, we need to identify the base of the exponential, a, and the exponent  y  since  y, is equal to, the log base a of x,  is equivalent to  x is equal to a to the y-th .

title: Determining the Exponential Form
text: What is the exponential form of the equation?
speech: What is the exponential form of the equation?
pacedSpeech: What is the exponential form of the equation?

title: Rewrite $$\frac{1}{27}$$ with base $$\frac{1}{3}$$
text: Since $$3^3=27$$, we can actually rewrite $$\frac{1}{27}$$ in terms of $$\frac{1}{3}$$. What is $$\frac{1}{27}$$ equal to in terms of $$\frac{1}{3}$$?
speech: Since  3 cubed is equal to 27 , we can actually rewrite  1 over 27,  in terms of  1 third . What is  1 over 27,  equal to in terms of  1 third ?
pacedSpeech: equal to in terms of   1 third

title: Solve for $$x$$
text: Substituting $${\left(\frac{1}{3}\right)}^3$$ into the exponential equation we found before, we get $${\left(\frac{1}{3}\right)}^x={\left(\frac{1}{3}\right)}^3$$. What is the solution for $$x$$ in this exponential equation?
speech: Substituting  parentheses 1 third  cubed  into the exponential equation we found before, we get , parentheses 1 third  to the x-th is equal to, parentheses 1 third  cubed . What is the solution for  x  in this exponential equation?
